title: Exploring Controversial Mathematical Topics: Activity-Based Learning Through Double-Blind Debates

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Fundamental Mathematics Concepts and Internet Research Skills
context.additional_context: The need for an interdisciplinary approach to controversial topics in mathematics education (e.g., standard curriculum reform, AI-based math assessments)

learning_goals: Learners can investigate both sides of a controversial issue within a set timeframe and construct structured logic
Learners can systematically present their arguments by citing credible sources
Learners can engage in professional and respectful discussions with peers on contentious topics
Learners can synthesize personal viewpoints based on a multidimensional understanding of mathematics-related social issues
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
